intro: Lachenalia kliprandensis, commonly known as the Kliprand lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of linear leaves. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences bearing clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid gardens.
